creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
description: dark brown vase with three pinched places on sides (two one side and one opposite); oblong mouth opening; roughly pear-shaped, narrow at mouth and wider bottom; short round foot; glaze varies from glossy to matte
markings: small square stamp next to base
text: Born and educated in ceramic design in Cork, Ireland, Flynn resides in County Cork today, concentrating on domestic-scale porcelain vessels. In the tradition of the Natzlers, she pinches and pulls her clay bodies to invite touch, while preserving their integrity as vehicles for both matte and high glazes. Her “hipped vessels” vary in size but remain a favorite form, in a variety of subtle colors.
title: Triple-Hipped Vessel
